alert.note: Alert for Bristol (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN BRISTOL AND NORTHEASTERN PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 458 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Lincoln, or near North Providence, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Pawtucket, Cumberland, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Lincoln, Central Falls, and Seekonk around 505 PM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
